articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dissolved the six-member war cabinet, an Israeli official said on Monday, in a widely expected move that came after the departure from government of the centrist former general Benny Gantz.
articles.title: Netanyahu disbands his inner war cabinet, Israeli official says

articles.author: Peter Hobson, Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Chinese Premier Li Qiang met on Monday in the first visit to the country by a Chinese premier in seven years, with trade ties, regional security and a jailed Australian writer on the host's agenda.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese, China's Li to discuss trade, jailed writer

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Khanh Vu
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit Hanoi this week, multiple officials said, highlighting Communist-ruled Vietnam's loyalty to Russia and triggering a U.S. rebuke.
articles.title: Russia's Putin to visit Vietnam, sparking US rebuke of Hanoi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Canadian Liberal government, criticized by opposition legislators for sending a patrol ship to Havana while Russian vessels were there, on Monday said the visit was meant to send a message of deterrence to Moscow.
articles.title: Canada defends sending ship to Cuba as vital to deterring Russia

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, William James
articles.description: Nigel Farage, whose entry into the British election has damaged Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's already faint hopes of victory, will on Monday set out his Reform UK party's policies, saying they should form the opposition to a Labour government.
articles.title: 'Join the revolt': UK's Farage to lay out election policies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Campaigning kicked off in France on Monday for a snap parliamentary election which opinion polls suggest the far-right National Rally will win, with President Emmanuel Macron's centrist alliance coming third, behind a leftwing ticket.
articles.title: Campaigning kicks off in France for snap election

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhary, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: A freight train smashed into the rear of a stationary passenger train in India's West Bengal state on Monday, killing at least 15 people and injuring dozens, police said, in an accident that railway authorities blamed on driver error.
articles.title: Train crash in eastern India kills 15, injures dozens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Monday that NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg's remarks about talks on deploying more nuclear weapons were an escalation.
articles.title: Kremlin says NATO chief's nuclear weapons remarks are an escalation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: European Union leaders will debate policy goals for the next five years from defence to the economy, and who to place in top EU jobs, when they convene in Brussels on Monday.
articles.title: EU leaders to discuss top jobs with line-up seemingly set

articles.author: Layli Foroudi
articles.description: In the Paris suburb where footballer Kylian Mbappe grew up, 22-year old Leana Aggoune said that she agrees with the French striker's call on young people to vote in the French parliamentary election this month.
articles.title: Mbappe's call to vote resonates with youth in his old neighbourhood
